bwwExcerpt: Anticipation for the latest revival of 'My Fair Lady' was high - the Lerner and Loewe classic, from 1956, had been absent from Broadway for nearly 25 years - but not entirely positive. After all, the story of a Cockney flower girl being bullied into learning upper-class speech by an abrasive male professor could feel out of touch, to put it mildly, in our modern climate. Happily, this Lincoln Center Theater production starring Lauren Ambrose and Harry Hadden-Paton is everything it needs to be, and quite a bit more.
showScoreExcerpt:
"Everything it needs to be, and quite a bit more...You know to expect a lavish spectacle. You won’t be disappointed...Director Bartlett Sher returned to the story’s origin in the George Bernard Shaw play 'Pygmalion' and made it more acceptable for our times without messing with the musical, but this isn’t a 'revisal'...If the central relationship is the jewel of 'My Fair Lady,' it gets a glorious setting here, from the high production values to the deluxe casting."
